name: 20120112 More than two rifles (not an automatic) seized - NL

properties.weapon details: Six rifles were seized during the arrest.
properties.event summary: 10/09/2011: On Sunday, in Allende Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Secretary of Defense agents (SEDENA) arrested two Gulf Cartel members. During the arrest, six rifles, two handguns, 42 magazines, and at least 2000 rounds of various caliber ammunition were seized.  No damages were reported. No casualties were reported.
properties.weapon details 2: Two handguns were seized during the arrest.
properties.location: The police operation occurred in Allende, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, 60 kilometers south of the capital.
properties.basic title: Two Gulf Cartel Members Arrested in Allende, Mexico

properties.weapon details: Two AR-15 guns were seized during the police operation.
properties.event summary: 10/23/2011: On Sunday night at 2300, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, four individuals were detained while they were in a stolen vehicle outside of an abandoned home between Calles Farolillo y Rafia in Fomerrey 116, north of Monterrey. The stolen gray Mondeo had license plate SNX3628. The suspects were identified as Armando Ortiz Aguilar alias "El Mono," Alan Haley Cruz Reyes alias "El Negro," Juan Carlos Lomas Reyes, and Sergio Arturo Lomas Reyes alias "El Camaron." Police seized nine AR-15 magazines, one AK-47 magazine, 76 magazine carriers, two tactical belts, five cellular phones, psychoactive pills, and one bag of cocaine. Police also seized two AR-15 guns, and a total of 751 of following ammunition: .223 7.62x39 millimeter rounds of ammunition, .40 caliber rounds of ammunition, .38 caliber rounds of ammunition, and .380 caliber rounds of ammunition.
properties.location: The police operation occurred outside of an abandoned home between Calles Farolillo y Rafia in Fomerrey 116, Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.
properties.basic title: Four Men Arrested for Auto Theft in Monterrey, Mexico

properties.weapon details: Six rifles were seized during the military operation.
properties.event summary: 10/23/2011:  On Sunday, in Doctor Gonzalez, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, military personnel arrested three individuals and killed one gunman.  The arrests took place after soldiers were attacked by assailants. The military personnel returned fire killing one individual, identified as Los Zetas member Gabriel Hernandez Hernandez, also known as El Cochiloco, who was allegedly in charge of Los Zetas criminal activities in Doctor Gonzalez. Gabriel Hernandez Herndndez was identified as the leader of the Marin and Higueras plazas for Los Zetas. Julio Cesar, Heriberto Roman Torres, and Jesus Contrera-Martinez were arrested. The assailants were burying four bodies for apparently refusing to work with the assailants prior to being arrested. The military personnel also seized two crew-cab pickups, six rifles, 45 magazines for different weapons, 480 different caliber rounds of ammunition, two doses of cocaine, and two doses of marijuana.
properties.location: The military operation took place in an unspecified rural area between the ranches of La Laja and El Oregano in Doctor Gonzalez, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.
properties.basic title: Military Personnel Disarm Extremist Group in Nuevo Leon
